title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs for registered nurses. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by authorizing education programs for registered nurses to become qualified to provide care for patients with acute and chronic illnesses. Additionally, the act defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a primary care facility managed by advanced practice nurses serving underserved populations. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by authorizing education programs for registered nurses to provide care for patients with acute and chronic illnesses. It defines a nurse-managed health clinic as a facility managed by advanced practice nurses serving underserved populations. The act also amends the Public Health Service Act to include clinical nurse specialists in nurse-practice arrangements. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs is addressed in Section 3. In General, Title VIII of the Public Health Service Act is amended to update various sections with new years, including loan repayment programs, nurse faculty loan program, and comprehensive geriatric education. Funding for carrying out parts B, C, and section 831 is also updated. Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to promote career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings and diverse population groups. The amendment to Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act promotes career advancement for nursing personnel through cross-training, specialty training, and advancement opportunities to become professional nurses, advanced education nurses, licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides. It also encourages individuals like licensed practical nurses, licensed vocational nurses, certified nurse assistants, home health aides, and diploma or associate degree nurses to pursue further education to become baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses to address the needs of the registered nurse workforce. The amendment to Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act encourages career advancement for nursing personnel by promoting cross-training, specialty training, and opportunities for licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides to pursue further education to become baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses. It also includes developing and implementing internships and residency programs in collaboration with accredited schools of nursing to encourage mentoring and specialty development. The amendment to Section 831 of the Public Health Service Act promotes career advancement for nursing personnel through cross-training, specialty training, and opportunities for further education. It also encourages the development of internships and residency programs in collaboration with nursing schools. Subsection (g) is amended to include nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
